definition: facing one another/face-to-face
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
surname Xiang
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to glower at each other (idiom)
sudden attack from the opposite direction (idiom)

sentences.english: The turbulent meeting ended in a fist fight.
sentences.chinese: 吵闹的会议最终以拳脚相向而结束。

sentences.english: And he laughs while he does it, he always added, scowling at his son.
sentences.chinese: 他总是加上这么一句，并对他的儿子怒目相向。

sentences.english: I can't bear to use harsh words against people.
sentences.chinese: 因为我的心太软，所以我不忍心对人恶言相向。

sentences.english: One car come, one car go, two car bong-bong, one people die.
sentences.chinese: 两车相向而行，相撞后一人死亡。

sentences.english: A deal is still possible, but the sides have come to loathe each other.
sentences.chinese: 协议仍存可能，只是双方已经开始恶语相向。

sentences.english: In disagreements, fight fairly. Please No name calling.
sentences.chinese: 意见相左时，不要怒目相向，也不要指名道姓争吵。

sentences.english: You can't be to flirty, mama, and know how to undress me.
sentences.chinese: 不要卖弄风情，女人，你知道如何让我赤裸相向。

sentences.english: The boys had an argument, but it never came to blows.
sentences.chinese: 这些男生有些争论，但从没到拳脚相向的程度。

sentences.english: The doping of Co, Ag, W can lower the transformation temperature of anatase to rutile.
sentences.chinese: 的掺杂会降低锐钛矿相向金红石相的转变温度。

sentences.english: The deal emerged late on Saturday after fractious public exchanges earlier in the day between Republicans and Democrats.
sentences.chinese: 在周六共和党和民主党恶语相向以后，协议浮出水面。

sentences.english: There is a two way communication line between us and our parents, we mutually co-exist.
sentences.chinese: 我们和父母的沟通是相向的，可以说是互相尊重。

sentences.english: Do not describe other people with critical words, say nothing of quarrel .
sentences.chinese: 不要用批评的语言说别人，更不要恶言相向。

sentences.english: And there was the on-set fight between Japanese and Chinese actors.
sentences.chinese: 在日本演员与中国演员之间也有拳脚相向情况出现。

sentences.english: Ding Hai to see two people pull on Tianlong fists.
sentences.chinese: 丁海见二人拉扯，对天朗挥拳相向。

sentences.english: Further out from the frontier facies exists pre-fan delta facies.
sentences.chinese: 前缘相向外，则为前扇三角洲相。
现在却要付出辛苦劳作，忍受恶言相向。

definition: to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
to glower at each other (idiom)
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
weapons/arms/fighting/war
to rip one's robe as a sign of repudiating a sworn brotherhood (idiom)/to break all friendly ties
wielding the halberd within the household (idiom); internecine strife
to be estranged
to cross over (e.g. traffic)/to intersect/to make friends
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
stranger
to split up/to break all ties
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
